title.narrative: Protecting Vulnerable People Against Noncommunicable Diseases Project

description.narrative: To contribute to: (i) improving the readiness of public health facilities to deliver higher quality NCD-services for vulnerable population groups and expanding the scope of selected services; and (ii) protecting vulnerable population groups against prevalent NCD risk factors.

condition.narrative: Finance Loan Agreement ::Section I.D of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement Description: The Borrower, through SGS shall, no laterthan six months after the Effective Date , hire an independent verification agent and an independent auditor to verify complianceof TLIs and execution of EEPs, respectively.

Loan Agreement :Section I.A.2 (b) of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementDescription: For purposes of implementing Parts 1.1 and 1.2of the Project, the Borrower, through SGS, shall sign an Annual Performance Agreement with each Participating Province. | Frequency:Yearly

Loan Agreement: Section I.A.2 (c) and (d) of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementDescription: For purposes of implementing Parts 1.1and 1.2 of the Project, the Borrower, through SGS, shall cause Participating Provinces to comply with the IPPF and ESMF.

Loan Agreement: Section I.B of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement.Description: the Borrower, through SGS shall carry out theProject in accordance with the Operational Manual and the Provincial Operative Guidelines.

Loan Agreement: Section I.A.2 (a) of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementDescription: For purposes of implementing Parts 1.1 and 2 ofthe Project, the Borrower, through SGS, shall, prior to providing financing to a respective Participating Province, sign aFramework Agreement with each Participating Province

Loan Agreement: Section I.E of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementDescription: Prior to carrying out any Subprojects under part 3.2of theProject, the Borrower, through SGS shall: (i) select Beneficiaries; and (ii)enter into Grant Agreements

Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Loan AgreementDescription: The Borrower, shall, through SGS: (a) maintain throughout executionof the Project: (i) a technical coordination unit; and (ii) an international health financing unit to manage Projectimplementation; and (b) cause the Participating Provinces to maintain during the execution of the Project, within the MSPstechnical staff
